name: Hotel De Tuilerieen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this holiday on a whim and it ended up being one of the best we have had. The staff at Hotel De Tuilerieen, the room, the 'Bruges Factor', the celebrations for Belgium's National Day and great weather all combined to provide us one of the best holiday ever.
reviews.title: 4* is better than 5*!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Perfection!!

likes.disliked: — we did have to wait for 1 hour for the rooms, but we did arrive at 12.00 and you do not have to check out till 11.00am so we were probably too early anyway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. The rooms. When we checked in, we were offered a junior suite for a small fee extra. It was brilliant. His and her bathroom sinks, heated floors, a FULL SIZE bath, fantastic antiques and parchments on the walls, two LCD tv's, a sitting room and our own courtyard. Add to that a turndown service at night - what more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Dirty Room offered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2. The staff. Quite simply, they are friendly, helpful and genuinely interested in you - the customer. Even the cleaning staff engage in conversation while you wait. The professionalism they display is a credit to them and the management - it is such a pleasure to be surrounded by that level of customer service. Even the breakfast staff, who are always 'under fire' trying to provide tables are second to none.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great location, chraming

likes.liked: — the location and old worlde charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Location. 400 meters from the Grote Markt - the centre square. Restaurants everywhere, chocolate shops everywhere, cafes everywhere, photo opportunities everywhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went here for a night on my two-year anniversary and it was absolutely perfect. The room we were given was immaculate and beautifully designed. The location was excellent and the staff were polite, if a little stiff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, I guarantee you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: One thing I would say is, upon arrival, ask for a choice of rooms. We did this, and were offered two very different rooms, one much nicer than the other. Also, prior to booking I asked for a discount, though it was high season, as I booked early i managed to knock off about 50 euros from the price.
reviews.title: A true gem (but difficult to find)

likes.liked: — Nice location, great staff, spacious rooms, nice amenities, good value
likes.disliked: — Not much - only that it is difficult to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall: This is a four star, small hotel (45 rooms) and quite a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great location, friendly staff, very romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location: Nice location in the old city. Once you are here, everything in the old town is accessible on foot (take a map). The issue we had was initially finding the place. We came in at night and construction in the one way streets really threw us off. The hotel did offer to send someone to come direct us, but we opted to find it ourselves. If not for the good will of a local who actually led us there, we would not have found the hotel. Travel in during the day by car might also be difficult because the small one way streets fill with tourists.
reviews.title: Comfort, style and location

likes.liked: — Large, well appointed room with comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — Small breakfast room that could barely cope with the number of guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities: This is an old 15th century mansion with lots of character. It has a small breakfast room and a dining room and small bar. It also has a pool open until 2AM. The pool area includes a hot tub, sauna, Turkish bath, washrooms, showers and water cooler. The pool is small, but nice. Towels are there for your use.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon at the Tuilerieen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights over Christmas and it was an excellent choice of destination as Bruges does not shut up shop over Christmas and there was plenty to do and see on Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Lots of superb restaurants - would recommend Mozarthuys - try the hot stone steaks and de Koetse - fantastic lamb cutlets. Beware the suites do not have canal views which are spectacular - we requested a canal view and the hotel moved us to an executive but we still had to pay for the suite - Expedias fault rather than the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Christmas destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wallet went missing one evening and the night porter found it in the toilet and kept it for me - how many hotel staff are that honest!
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bonus points for BBC1, 2 and ITV on television. World Service gets very tedious!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
perfect stay!
reviews.text: Minus points for no tea/ coffee facilities in room and no option for breakfast except 30 euro pp champagne/chocolate feast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely return to this friendly, comfortable hotel
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in an excellent location

likes.liked: — The location and the beauty of the building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here with our 7 year old son for one night and loved the hotel. It is beautifully furnished, with fabulous Venetian crystal windows throughout, has a nice pool that is just the right size for a short stay, and is in a great location for discovering Bruges. Our family room was big and beautifully appointed and the staff were very helpful. Leo loved the huge chocolate fountain at breakfast (check the photos!) as did we the champagne included in the buffet for guests to help themselves to - we've stayed in some luxurious hotels but none have given free champagne with breakfast!
reviews.title: Great luxury character hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others. The horse and carriage ride from the square is good value for money, as is the canal trip. A visit to the Chocolate Story museum of chocolate is good for kids. We ate at Caffedral which was moderately to high priced but excellent, especially the seafood soup which is a meal in itself.
reviews.title: first class stay.

likes.liked: — the central location and help from the staff
likes.disliked: — drinks expensive and no tea and coffee in the room.

reviews.title: good hotel but needs more attention to detail
reviews.text: We stayed for a romantic weekend under one of their 'for your pleasure' arrangements. It was great! The room was lovely, the restaurants they sent us to were nice.. and ALL the drinks were included... wonderful... boat trip was worthwhile. Downside, drinks very expensive, no tea and coffee in the room and pool is tiny and in full view of everyone walking in and out of the hotel! Otherwise we will definitely return. It is centrally placed but off the main drag so it's quiet in the evening. And the ladies were great help, thanks to Charlotx2 and Vanessa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be very much as describewd by others on thuis site. Our room was large with 2 double beds which were very comfortable. The bathroom was large. However, the decor is starting to look shabby, and the tv remote was just about held together by tape. At night the room could get very hot. The secondary glazing was loose at the bottom of the frame. Thr right hand window was difficult to shut or open as the catch was distorted. The minibar was not alwys restocked.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was not really conducive to sitting and talking, and when more that 4 people present was cramped.
reviews.title: the best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second time staying at Hotel De Tuilerieen, we stayed here last year and found it so charming we came back this year for our honeymoon. Last time we stayed in a standard room overlooking the canal, well what can I say, it might have been standard to the hotel but to most people it would be top of the range, anyway as it was our honeymoon so we stayed in an executive room with a canal view, it was so lovely and perfect for a honeymoon. The hotel is just so friendly and the staff are fantastic. Last time we stayed we never had breakfast as it is rather expensive and there are so many tea rooms to get breakfast at very reasonable prices but this time as a treat we had breakfast on two mornings in the hotel, yes it was expensive but the best buffet breakfast we have ever seen, smoked salmon and champayne, chocolate fountain, 6 different breads, cheeses, pancakes and so on and on, it really is worth having breakfast just once to treat yourself, the breakfast room is just gorgous so go on splurge yourself. The Hotel De Tuilerieen is the perfect place to stay in this truely lovely location.
reviews.title: honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel De Tuilerieen in November of 2007.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a fantastic central location in Bruges. We had a suite and it was well worth the money. The decor was lovely and the beds extremely comfortable!
reviews.title: charming hotel

likes.liked: — the friendliness of all the staff, the location, the ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We used the pool which is small but adequate for a quick swim. The sauna was lovely too. The steam room was out of order so we can't comment on that.
reviews.title: As good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did think the breakfast was a little over priced 30 EUR per person but it was fine, nothing special. You have to give the chocolate fountain a try but a helping of chocolate first thing in the morning was not really our thing.
reviews.title: Georgeous, wonderful hotel!

likes.liked: — Absolutely everything - what a fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I just spent four wonderful days in Bruges at the Hotel De Tuilereen to celebrate our 11th anniversary. What a gorgeous city it is and the accommodations were just fantastic.
reviews.title: A stunner! Absolutely perfect!

likes.liked: — The luxurious high standard mix of elegance and maximum comfort offered by the De Tuilerieen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a view of the canal, the feather-top beds were very comfortable and the decor was elegant and sumptuous. Our bathroom was also top-notch...we had an enormous bathtub and a separate shower stall and two sinks. It was a nice touch to have the toilet in a separate small room, but alas, no bidet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — No coffee making facilities in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast room is really lovely...what a perfectly charming place to enjoy the lavish champagne buffet. There was something for every taste, a nice assortment of cheeses, charcuterie (chorizo, sausages, prosciutto etc.), baked goods and breads, crepes with several fillings, smoked salmon, fresh juices, fresh fruit, whole or as a salad, and best of all, a chocolate fountain to dip chunks of fruit in. And if that wasn't enough, the kitchen will happily prepare eggs to order. We had custom-made cheese omelets and bacon every morning.
reviews.title: Nice 3/4 star -- No more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bar is perhaps the loveliest of the public rooms and a wonderful place to wind down at the end of the day.
reviews.title: De TuilerieenLuxury

likes.disliked: — not enough space at breakfast table

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and eager to please. We were greeted warmly, day after day, by every member of the staff that we encountered.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nigths at the De Tulerieen. Is a lovely, romantic and perfect hotel. Excellent location, beautiful rooms, large bathrooms and a very romantic common areas. The only complaint is that the breakfast is too expensive. 25 euros for breakfast is too much. It doesn't matter if they have champange or a chocolate fountain, you can have a decent breakfast near the square for 12 euros or even less.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Except for the breakfast, the place is absolutly wonderful.
reviews.title: The most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in...

likes.liked: — The BED!.... and the view, and very plesant and curteous staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe even the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in period.
reviews.title: Top class 'boutique' hotel in central position in charming Bruges

likes.disliked: — Kids/ toddlers would have to be careful with full length windows in bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the "Cupido Arrangement" which included champagne, a superior room with canal view, dinner at a local restaurant (Den Djiver - the best dinner we ate this entire trip to Europe), and champagne buffet breakfast. Due to the transit strike in Paris we actually extended our stay to 5 nights instead of just the one and it was by far the best decision we made our whole trip. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly (notably Geoffrey and Jeremy as well as the cleaning staff whose names we did not get.) The bathroom was huge with a decent-sized tub and separate stall shower. Room furnishings were beautiful, either antique or antique inspired, all making for a very romantic and beautiful setting.
reviews.title: One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in in one of the loveliest hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The on-site bar is a nice place to start or end the evening, though admittedly a bit expensive. Due to the cold weather, we did not make use of the pool and chose to spend our free time in the evenings by the fireplace instead.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in excellent location

likes.liked: — Lovely location, go for a canal view room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Brugge in the off-season with a friend and got a great rate at this hotel. The location is fantastic and the hotel is immaculately maintained. We were upgraded to a superior deluxe room, which was up a very narrow set of stairs, but it was well worth it when we finally hauled all our luggage up. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable and plush, the private balcony looked out into a quiet courtyard, and the bathroom was beautifully modern.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and provided us with a map as well as directions to tourist sites without us asking. The small hotel bar was also a nice place for a nightcap after a long day of sightseeing. They were doing some renovations with the facilities (the main entrance was closed and the turkish bath was out of order), but being their outside of the major tourist season was well worth it.
reviews.title: Just Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not at all a luxury room!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have booked a special tariff that was also offered in other reservation websites.
reviews.title: Delightful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I checked the photos in several websites, including the hotel's website and the rooms I got were totally different from what I supposed I had bought.
reviews.title: Loved the Tuilerieen

likes.liked: — The spacious, stylish rooms and the comfortable beds!
likes.disliked: — The breakfast is a bit pricey

description: Atmospheric Hotel housed in elegantly restored 15th-century Flemish mansion, decorated with antiques, art objects & rich fabrics.
